modules.comments: Some specialized functions can be found here.

declarations.comments:
Make a projection of an array then sort the original array by the projection

```purescript
sortWithBy (\x -> if x == "dog" then 2 else 1) compare ["apple", "dog", "kiwi"] = ["apple", "kiwi", "dog"]
```
declarations.title: sortWithBy

declarations.comments:
Like `difference` but takes a comparison function.

```purescript
differenceBy (\a b -> toLower a == toLower b) ["apple", "dog"] ["KIWI", "DOG"] == ["KIWI"]
```
declarations.title: differenceBy

declarations.comments:
Try to make a projection from an array. Return an array with the projection and the original array with the elements removed.

```purescript
partitionProjection (\x -> if x == "dog" then Just "cat" else Nothing) ["apple", "dog", "kiwi"] == { no: ["apple", "kiwi"], yes: ["cat"] }
```
declarations.title: partitionProjection

declarations.comments:
Find an element which could be projected into another value.

```purescript
firstSuccessfulProjection (\x -> if x == 2 then Just "Found two" else Nothing) [1,2,3] == Just "Found Two"
```
declarations.title: firstSuccessfulProjection

declarations.comments:
Like unionBy between array A and array B. With elements left out from B being included when they match the predicate.

Useful for updating matching elements and at the same time inserting new ones that match the insert criteria

```purescript
unionByWhen
  (\a b -> a.id == b.id)
  (\{t} -> not $ null t)
  [{id: 1, t: "old"}, {id: 2, t: "old"}]
  [{id: 2, t: "new"}, {id: 3, t: ""}, {id: 4, t: "new"}]
    = [{id: 1, t: "old"}, {id: 2, t: "new"}, {id: 4, t: "new"}]
```

Truth table
         | in A   | not in A    |
in B     | update | insert-when |
not in B | keep   | n/a         |
declarations.title: unionByWhen

declarations.comments: Map with a function that yields `Either`. Only succeeding when all elements where mapped to `Right`.
declarations.title: mapEither

modules.name: Data.Array.Extra

modules.comments: This module defines functions that do something with an array based on a predicate.

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and return it together with the array without the element.

```purescript
extract (== 2) [1,2,3] == Just {found: 2, remaining: [1,3]}
```
declarations.title: extract

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and return an array without that element when it was found.

```purescript
deleteWith (== 2) [1,2,3] == Just [1,3]
```
declarations.title: deleteWith

declarations.comments:
Append an element to the end of the array when it could not be found by the predicate.

```purescript
snocWith (== 2) [1,3] 2 == Just [1,3,2]
```
declarations.title: snocWith

declarations.comments:
Append an element to the end of the array when it could not be found by the predicate.

```purescript
snocWith [1,3] 2 == Just [1,3,2]
```
declarations.title: snocWith'

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and when it was not found return an array with the element pushed to the front.

```purescript
consWith 2 [1,3] == Just [2,1,3]
```
declarations.title: consWith

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and when it was not found return an array with the element pushed to the front.

```purescript
consWith [1,3] 2 == Just [2,1,3]
```
declarations.title: consWith'

declarations.comments:
Insert the element into a sorted array but only if the element can not be found by the predicate.

```purescript
insertByWith (== 2) (\a b -> compare a b) 2 [1,3]  == Just [1,2,3]
```
declarations.title: insertByWith

declarations.comments:
Insert the element into a sorted array but only if the element didn't exist before.

```purescript
insertByWith (\a b -> compare a b) 2 [1,3]  == Just [1,2,3]
```
declarations.title: insertByWith'

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and return an array with the updated element when it was found

```purescript
updateWith (== 2) 4 [1,2,3] == Just [1,4,3]
```
declarations.title: updateWith

declarations.comments:
Find an element by a predicate and return an array with the updated element when it was found

```purescript
modifyWith (== 2) (* 3) [1,2,3] == Just [1,6,3]
```
declarations.title: modifyWith

modules.name: Data.Array.Extra.Find

modules.comments:
This module defines functions that conditionally map over a functor.
Outputting both the new functor and the old values that were replaced.

declarations.comments: Like map but extracts the replaced values into an array. Allows modification of the replaced values as well.
declarations.title: mapModify

declarations.comments: Conditionally map the function over the the functor. Returns a Tuple with the new functor and the replaced values.
declarations.title: mapMaybeWrite

declarations.comments:
Same as mapMaybeWrite but allows modification of replaced values before returning them.
Useful when the old and new values need to be linked to each other.
declarations.title: mapMaybeWriteModify

modules.name: Data.Array.Extra.FunctorWriter

modules.comments: Unsafe but faster functions due to no out of bounds checking.

declarations.comments:
Delete the element at index `i` in an array

```purescript
unsafePartial $ unsafeDeleteAt 1 ["a", "b", "c"] = ["a", "c"]
```
declarations.title: unsafeDeleteAt

declarations.comments:
Insert the element at index `i` in an array

```purescript
unsafePartial $ unsafeInsertAt 1 "b" ["a", "c"] = ["a", "b", "c"]
```
declarations.title: unsafeInsertAt

declarations.comments:
Overwrite the element at index `i` in an array

```purescript
unsafePartial $ unsafeUpdateAt 1 "e" ["a", "b", "c"] = ["a", "e", "c"]
```
declarations.title: unsafeUpdateAt

declarations.comments:
Overwrite the element at index `i` in an array

```purescript
unsafePartial $ unsafeModifyAt 1 (\a -> a <> "e") ["a", "b", "c"] = ["a", "be", "c"]
```
declarations.title: unsafeModifyAt

declarations.comments:
Get the first element in an array. Passing `Nothing` to `unsafeHead` will throw an error at
runtime.
declarations.title: unsafeHead

modules.name: Data.Array.Extra.Unsafe

modules.comments: Functions that either update or insert an element into an array.

declarations.comments:
Modify an element when it was found by the predicate or append a new element to the end of the array.

```purescript
modifyOrSnoc (== 2) (* 3) [1,2,3] 11 == Just [1,6,3]
modifyOrSnoc (== 4) (* 3) [1,2,3] 11 == Just [1,2,3,11]
```
declarations.title: modifyOrSnoc

declarations.comments:
Modify an element when it was found by the predicate or push a new element to the front of the array.

```purescript
modifyOrCons (== 2) (* 3) 11 [1,2,3] == Just [1,6,3]
modifyOrCons (== 4) (* 3) 11 [1,2,3] == Just [11,1,2,3]
```
declarations.title: modifyOrCons

declarations.comments:
Update an element when it was found by the predicate or append a new element to the end of the array.

```purescript
updateOrSnoc (== 2) [1,2,3] 11 == Just [1,11,3]
updateOrSnoc (== 4) [1,2,3] 11 == Just [1,2,3,11]
```
declarations.title: updateOrSnoc

declarations.comments:
Update an element when it was found by the predicate or push a new element to the front of the array.

```purescript
updateOrCons (== 2) 11 [1,2,3] == Just [1,11,3]
updateOrCons (== 4) 11 [1,2,3] == Just [11,1,2,3]
```
declarations.title: updateOrCons

modules.name: Data.Array.Extra.Upsert
